unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: What's the Simulation?
question_text: A $6$-sided die was rolled $100$ times with answers recorded in order. These answers were examined $2$ at a time, and each time a pair contained the same number, this was noted. The number of pairs with the same set of numbers was then divided by $50$ and given as a probability estimate. This simulation describes which of the following situations?

choices.text: For a statistics project, a student randomly selected $100$ students and asked their gender. Then the students' grade point averages were split evenly into $6$ groups. The student wanted to estimate the probability of finding two of the same gender in the same grade point average group.

The SAT scores at a high school were split evenly into $6$ groups based on total scores. The students in each group were assigned a number from $1$ to $6$. For a statistics project a student wanted to estimate the probability of one student being in the same group as another student.

The SAT scores at a high school were split evenly into $6$ groups based on total scores. The students in each group were assigned a number from $1$ to $6$. For a statistics project a student wanted to estimate the probability of how often a student's verbal score fell into the same category as the math score.

A school divided its students evenly into $6$ groups to assign to its $6$ guidance counselors. The students of each counselor were assigned a number from $1$ to $6$. For a statistics project a student wanted to estimate the probability of picking two random students at a time and seeing if they had the same counselor.

A school divided its students evenly into 6 groups to assign to its 6 guidance counselors. The students of each counselor were assigned a number from 1 to 6. For a statistics project a student wanted to estimate the probability of picking two random students at a time and seeing if they were of the same gender.
